Description: Rim sherd of East Greek pottery bowl; interior glazed black with one band in added red; exterior: thin black band over top of rim; reserved below with groups of narrow vertical strokes; part of black zone at bottom.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Royal Ontario Museum, Toronto. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
From a rosette or lotus bowl.
Bibliographic references: Hayes 1992 / Greek and Greek-Style Pottery and Plain Pottery in the Royal Ontario Museum; Excluding Black-Figure and Red-Figure Vases (p. 207, no. N21)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.390)
